review: This little device is a fantastic compromise for those with older model tvs that do not have Smart TV capability.How it works is you plug Chromecast into a HDMI connection (you must have one HDMI slot free on your TV), and then it sources your wifi signal and gets your older model TV online. It requires you to use a tablet to use it properly .. so basically you turn on your TV, flip to Chromecast through your TV's source list, then open up the Chromecast app on your tablet and what you see on your tablet, you see on your TV now. That includes apps like NetFlix, Youtube, etc.The easiest way to understand how to use Chromecast is to consider your tablet like your television's remote control. You use the tablet to set what you want to see on the big screen of your TV.At the moment, in Canada, apps are limited. But the product is being heavily invested by Google, so expect more and more apps and choices to pop up as the system matures. With some fancy footwork, you can also set up your DNS to get U.S.-side apps, but you'll have to (pun intended) google to get more info on that.For those tired of paying high cable fee rates, this is a wonderful alternative to modernize any TV in your house into an Internet capable smart TV.
